channel.title: Reading .txt files in the client?
channel.description:
I want to be able to read my .txt file from client. So convert the text in my .txt file to player.getActionSender().sendAlert("My txt stuff in here.");
Any ideas guys?

item.title: Reading .txt files in the client?
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

The problem is how you would display it in client. You could create a plain text buy command for example, where instead of specifying ids, you type item names. That sort of use seems doesn’t seem to be best accomplished in the game client though. Building a website to handle lookups with images and long descriptions using a MySQL database is how several large servers and tip.it sites did it. My friend is growing to begin working on a node.js+strongloop built prototype player management interface website and may see about connecting it to the nodebb forum user sessions and data on the mongo database that I have nodebb using for storage. I don’t know enough about mongodb yet to know if it is a good candidate to replace MySQL for game server database operations of if it is just another hyped hipster buzzword application that node.js works with. Redis json storage is memory intensive and probably wouldn’t withstand a large DDoS before eating the RAM and swap.
